intro: Orchis cordigera f. simonkaiana, commonly known as the Simonka's heartleaf orchid, is a rare and distinctive orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, often purple or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and a complex floral structure typical of the Orchidaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
